trans-unit.source: Dynamic SQL in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Dynamic SQL in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for using dynamic SQL in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for using dynamic SQL in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic SQL in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Dynamic SQL in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: When developing application code for SQL Data Warehouse you may find yourself needing to use dynamic sql to help deliver flexible, generic and modular solutions.
trans-unit.target: When developing application code for SQL Data Warehouse you may find yourself needing to use dynamic sql to help deliver flexible, generic and modular solutions.

trans-unit.source: However, SQL Data Warehouse does not support blob data types at this time.
trans-unit.target: However, SQL Data Warehouse does not support blob data types at this time.

trans-unit.source: This may limit the size of your strings as blob types include both varchar(max) and nvarchar(max) types.
trans-unit.target: This may limit the size of your strings as blob types include both varchar(max) and nvarchar(max) types.

trans-unit.source: You may find that you have used these types in your application code when building very large strings of dynamic SQL code you need to execute.
trans-unit.target: You may find that you have used these types in your application code when building very large strings of dynamic SQL code you need to execute.

trans-unit.source: In these situations you will need to break the code into chunks and use the EXEC statement instead.
trans-unit.target: In these situations you will need to break the code into chunks and use the EXEC statement instead.

trans-unit.source: A simplified example is available below:
trans-unit.target: A simplified example is available below:

trans-unit.source: If the string is not particularly long then you can use [sp_executesql][] as normal.
trans-unit.target: If the string is not particularly long then you can use [sp_executesql][] as normal.

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see [development overview][].
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see [development overview][].
